integrations_researched.name: GreenshiftWP
integrations_researched.description: WordPress page builder and animation blocks plugin with dynamic data capabilities

verified_package.name: greenshift-animation-and-page-builder-blocks
verified_package.install_command: WordPress Plugin - Install via WordPress dashboard or wp plugin install greenshift-animation-and-page-builder-blocks

dynamic_data_sources: ACPT (All in One Custom Post Types) fields
key_blocks: Meta Getter - Retrieves any meta field value
Query Loop Builder - Query and display posts/CPTs
Repeater Builder - Display repeatable data sources
Dynamic Chart - Display data from API/meta

verified_filters.purpose: Register custom fonts in Greenshift font selector
Set default container width in pixels

required_addons.name: Query Addon (premium)
required_addons.purpose: Required for dynamic data features including Meta Getter block
required_addons.note: Part of Greenshift All-in-One plan or sold separately

infrastructure.database: Uses WordPress standard meta tables (postmeta, usermeta, options)
infrastructure.note: Greenshift reads from WordPress meta storage - custom tables require integration layer

gotchas: Greenshift Dynamic Fields work with WordPress meta (post_meta, user_meta) - NOT custom database tables
Query Addon (premium) required for Meta Getter and dynamic data features
FRS User Profiles stores data in custom table wp_frs_profiles - NOT in WordPress meta
To integrate, FRS data must be exposed via WordPress meta, shortcodes, or custom blocks
Dynamic shortcodes from other plugins may not render in Query Loop without special handling
ACPT field keys require group prefix (e.g., 'group_field' not just 'field')

integrations_researched.name: FRS User Profiles Plugin
integrations_researched.description: Existing plugin that needs to be integrated with Greenshift

verified_package.name: frs-wp-users
verified_package.note: Local plugin - not from package repository

gotchas: Data stored in custom table NOT WordPress meta - requires integration layer for Greenshift
Many fields are JSON type (arrays) - need special handling for Greenshift
Profile can exist without WordPress user (guest profiles)

integration_approaches.description: Mirror FRS profile data to WordPress user meta so Greenshift can read it natively
pros: Works with all Greenshift dynamic features
cons: Must sync on every profile save
Guest profiles (no user_id) won't have user meta

integration_approaches.description: Create shortcodes like [frs_field name='first_name'] that output individual field values
cons: Not true dynamic data - static shortcode output
May have issues in Query Loop context
Less flexible than native dynamic fields
integration_approaches.implementation_pattern: Create new shortcodes that accept field name and profile identifier

integration_approaches.description: Create integration that registers FRS fields as Greenshift-compatible custom fields
cons: Requires deep understanding of Greenshift internals
integration_approaches.implementation_pattern: Unknown - no public API documentation for custom field sources

integration_approaches.description: Combine user meta sync for logged-in users with shortcodes for flexibility
pros: Works for both users and guests
integration_approaches.implementation_pattern: Sync core fields to user_meta + provide shortcodes for all fields

unverified_claims.claim: Greenshift has PHP filters/hooks to register custom dynamic data sources
unverified_claims.reason: No documentation found for programmatically registering custom data sources. Official docs only cover UI-based field configuration.
unverified_claims.recommendation: Use documented integration patterns (user meta, shortcodes) rather than undocumented internals

unverified_claims.claim: Query Addon is required for all dynamic features
unverified_claims.reason: Multiple sources indicate Query Addon is needed for Meta Getter and dynamic data, but couldn't verify exact feature split between free and premium
unverified_claims.recommendation: Confirm Query Addon is installed/licensed before implementing dynamic data integration

recommendations.recommendation: Implement User Meta Sync for Core Fields
recommendations.details: Hook into 'frs_profile_saved' action to sync key profile fields (first_name, last_name, job_title, phone, email, social URLs, headshot_url) to WordPress user meta. This enables native Greenshift Meta Getter usage for logged-in users.
Create [frs_field name='field_name' profile_id='X'] shortcodes that output individual field values. This provides flexibility for any field and works with guest profiles.
Confirm Greenshift Query Addon is installed and licensed, as it's required for Meta Getter block and dynamic data features.
Fields like languages, specialties, awards are JSON arrays. Create shortcodes that format these appropriately (comma-separated, list, etc.).
Greenshift's Query Loop has special context handling. Test shortcodes within Query Loop to ensure they receive proper post/user context.

field_mapping_for_user_meta.description: Recommended mapping from FRS profile fields to WordPress user meta for Greenshift compatibility
